body:
I see what you are saying... I find that providing the complete table and even adjust it for different platforms is to much. Also the message would need more maintenance and can easily get outdated. I favor a more vague version.

What I find interesting is the two error scenarios you mentioned. I experimented a bit and noticed that when the adapter is found a `Gem::LoadError` is raised in place of the `LoadError`.

```
#<Gem::LoadError: mysql2 is not part of the bundle. Add it to Gemfile.>
#<Gem::LoadError: pg is not part of the bundle. Add it to Gemfile.>
#<Gem::LoadError: sqlite3 is not part of the bundle. Add it to Gemfile.>
```

The current version detects the error scenario and displays the accurate error message (the wording could probably be improved).

@fxn What do you think?
